article.headline: The Citadel 58, Bethune-Cookman 57
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. -- Demetrius Nelson scored 18 points as The Citadel held on to beat Bethune-Cookman 58-57 on Saturday night. Cameron Wells added 10 points for the Bulldogs (6-7), who shot 56 percent from the field (14 of 25) in the second half to overcome a 12-point deficit at halftime. C.J. Reed led the Wildcats (6-7) with 23 points and Alexander Starling scored 14. Bethune-Cookman made just seven of its 17 second-half shots from the floor, and were outscored 34-21 in the second half. After Wells hit a jumper to put The Citadel ahead 58-53 with 1:05 to play, Bethune-Cookman went on a 4-0 run in the game's last minute but could pull no closer than the final margin.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
